headline: U.S. Stocks Amble to Fresh Records on Optimism for a September Rate Cut
summary: Investors dialed up bets on Wednesday that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates in September, lifting the S&P 500 and Nasdaq composite to record closing highs for the second straight day.  Tuesday’s inflation report showed that price increases held steady in July, and on Wednesday, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said there was a good chance the central bank could slash rates by half a percentage point next month.  In a television interview, Bessent suggested borrowing costs might eventually drop by 1.5 points or more.

headline: U.S. Treasury Yields Fall as Investors Weigh September Cut
summary: Treasurys rallied to send yields lower as investors chewed over the Fed’s next likely move at a highly uncertain moment.
